prompt: Photorealistic close-up of a watchmaker's weathered wooden workbench, bathed in warm, focused light from a desk lamp. Centered in the 16:9 frame, hands wearing finger cots carefully hold a vintage chronograph watch with its caseback open, revealing intricate gears. A jeweler's loupe is held up to one eye, examining the movement. Assorted watchmaking tools (small screwdrivers, tweezers, movement holder) are artfully scattered in the foreground and background, creating depth. Shallow depth of field, emphasizing the watch and hands. Style: Professional, detailed, slightly nostalgic. --ar 16:9
name: value-of-old-watches-image-1.png

prompt: Expansive flat lay composition showcasing a diverse collection of 8-10 vintage watches arranged horizontally across a rich, dark velvet surface, filling the 16:9 frame. Include various styles: elegant gold dress watches, robust steel chronographs, early digital watches, and simple time-only pieces from different eras (1940s-1980s). Varying degrees of patina and wear are visible. Soft, diffused overhead lighting ensures even illumination, highlighting textures and details without harsh shadows. Style: Museum-quality display, informative, detailed photorealism. --ar 16:9
name: value-of-old-watches-image-2.png

prompt: Dramatic macro shot focusing on a single, high-value vintage luxury watch (e.g., a gold Patek Philippe Calatrava or early Rolex Submariner style) resting partially on an antique, leather-bound book. Positioned off-center in the 16:9 frame to allow background context. The background features a dimly lit, sophisticated study with hints of dark wood paneling and perhaps a crystal whiskey decanter, softly blurred. Chiaroscuro lighting dramatically highlights the watch's polished surfaces, patina, and intricate dial details. Style: Luxurious, moody, cinematic photorealism, emphasizing rarity and value. --ar 16:9
name: value-of-old-watches-image-3.png

prompt: Split-screen style composition within the 16:9 frame, directly comparing two vintage watches of the same model or very similar style. Left side: The watch is in pristine, near-mint condition with a clean dial, sharp case lines, and bright lume. Right side: The watch shows significant wear â€“ scratched crystal, faded bezel, heavily patinated dial, worn case. Both watches are presented against a neutral, textured grey background under clean, even studio lighting to clearly showcase the differences in condition and their impact on appearance. Style: Comparative, analytical, hyperrealistic detail. --ar 16:9
name: value-of-old-watches-image-4.png

prompt: Wide-angle shot capturing the interior of a brightly lit, modern auction house preview or high-end vintage watch dealer display case, filling the 16:9 aspect ratio. Several desirable vintage watches (Rolex, Omega, Heuer styles) are professionally presented on individual stands behind reflective glass. Subtle reflections add realism. The focus is sharp on the watches, while the background shows blurred figures of potential buyers examining other displays, suggesting a bustling market environment. Clean, bright, gallery-style lighting. Style: Commercial, professional, aspirational photorealism, context of sale. --ar 16:9
name: value-of-old-watches-image-5.png
